Description: White steatite scarab: engraved on the base with a beetle, very summarily executed, with four legs only. Above and below, the red crown of Lower Egypt, one upside down. There is a hole pierced through longitudinally.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.72, no.39)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Bagshaw Museum and Art Gallery, Batley
